Column Comment.0: COST ID: unique identifier for each cost.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AMI IND: Indicates the cost was incurred for an AMI created under a contract
Column Comment.3: CONFIDENTIAL IND: Indicates the cost is confidential and should not be disclosed toother parties.
Column Comment.5: COST PER SIZE: The cost per size unit (such as dollars per km)
Column Comment.6: COST PER SIZE OUOM: original unit of measure used, such as Cdn dollars per km
Column Comment.7: FINANCE CENTER COST TYPE: the type of cost associated with the AFE or costcenter.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.9: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: AFE COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the AFE Component. Eachbusiness object that is associated with this AFE should have its own component ID.
Column Comment.13: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.14: PAID DATE: The date that this cost was paid. For details on fulfillment, use theobligation module.
Column Comment.15: PARENT COST IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the cost that is the parent of thisreported cost. Used in the case where cost breakdowns and summaries are reported.Use the REPORT COST IND flag to ensure that costs are not reported or addedmore than once in summaries.
Column Comment.16: PERCENT OF PARENT: If you are using the parent costs relationship to track theallocation of costs this value is used to record how much of the parent costs havebeen allocated to the subordinate cost.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: REPORT COSTS INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating whether these costs areincluded in a cost report. If you are using the parent costs relationship to track theallocation of costs, this flag is used to ensure that you do not reports costs twice.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: SUBMIT DATE: the date that this cost was submitted.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
